casebody.data:
INTERSTATE COMMERCE COMMISSION, Plaintiff-Appellee, v. INTERSTATE AUTO SHIPPERS, INC. and Alfred M. Rappeport, Defendants-Appellants. No. 40, Docket 28197. United States Court of Appeals Second Circuit. Argued Oct. 9, 1963. Decided Oct. 21, 1963. Emanuel Rothstein, New York City, for defendants-appellants. Seymour Glanzer, Atty., Interstate Commerce Commission, New York City (Bernard A. Gould, Atty., Interstate Commerce Commission, Washington, D. C. , and Morton B. Margulies, Atty., Interstate Commerce Commission, New York City, <on the brief), for plaintiff-appellee.

Before CLARK, MOORE and KAUFMAN, Circuit Judges.

PER CURIAM.

The preliminary injunction restraining defendants is affirmed on' the well reasoned opinion of District Judge Levet, D.C.S.D.N.Y., 214 F.Supp. 473.
